wbml.data.data module¶

class wbml.data.data.Data(x, y, names)[source]¶

Bases: plum.resolvable.Referentiable

Data set.

Parameters:
  • x (tensor) – Inputs.
  • y (tensor) – Outputs.
  • names – Names of the outputs.
cast(dtype)[source]¶

Cast the data to a particular data type.

Parameters:dtype (dtype) – Date type to cast to.
Returns:Data casted to dtype.
Return type:data.Data
concat_xy(other)[source]¶

Concatenate outputs from another data set at new inputs.

Parameters:other (data.Data) – Other data set.
Returns:Concatenation.
Return type:data.Data
concat_y(other)[source]¶

Concatenate outputs from another data set at the current inputs.

Parameters:other (data.Data) – Other data set.
Returns:Concatenation.
Return type:data.Data
interval(x_start, x_end, start_inclusive=True, end_inclusive=False)[source]¶

Select a interval of the data.

Parameters:
  • x_start – Start of the interval.
  • x_end – End of the interval.
  • start_inclusive (bool, optional) – The start value is inclusive. Defaults to True.
  • end_inclusive (bool, optional) – The end value is inclusive. Defaults to False.
Returns:

Selected interval and the entire data

with the interval set to missing.
Return type:

tuple[data.Data]
interval_y(names, *args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Select an interval from a particular output. Further takes in arguments for data.Data.interval().

Parameters:*names (str) – Outputs to select the interval from.
Returns:The selected interval and the remainder.
Return type:tuple[data.Data]

Number of features.

Merge a number of data sets.

Parameters:*ds (data.Data) – Data sets to merge.
Returns:Merged data set.
Return type:data.Data
merge_x()[source]¶

Safely merge outputs for duplicate inputs.

Returns:Data with duplicate inputs merged.
Return type:data.Data
n¶

Number of data points.

normalise(ref=None, unnormaliser=False)[source]¶

Normalise data.

Parameters:
  • ref (data.Data, optional) – Reference to normalise with respect to. Defaults to itself.
  • unnormaliser (bool, optional) – Also return a function to unnormalise data. Defaults to False.
Returns:

Normalised data. Can further return a

function to unnormalise data.
Return type:

data.Data

Number of outputs.

Parameters:*names – Outputs to select.

Shuffle the data.

Returns:Shuffled data.

split(f)[source]¶

Split the data.

Parameters:point (int or float) – Point to split the data at. Can either be an int, representing an index, or a float, representing a fractional point.
Returns:First and second part of the data.
Return type:tuple[data.Data]
truncate(x)[source]¶

Truncate the data. Takes in arguments like data.Data.split().

Returns:Truncated data.
Return type:data.Data
class wbml.data.data.CSVReader[source]¶

Bases: object

Read and parse a CSV.

add_field(column_name, type, output_name=None)[source]¶

Add a field.

Parameters:
  • column_name (str) – Name of column.
  • type (type or function) – Type of column. Can also be a function that convert the value into the right type.
  • output_name (str, optional) – Change the name of the column.
read(file_name, delimiter=', ', cache=False)[source]¶

Read and parse a CSV.

Parameters:
  • file_name (str) – File name.
  • delimiter (str, optional) – Delimiter. Defaults to a comma.
  • cache (bool, optional) – Use a cache if available. Defaults to False.
set_field_group(name, matrix=True)[source]¶

Create a group of fields.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Name of group.
  • matrix (bool, optional) – Output group as a matrix instead of a dictionary. Defaults to True.

Parameters:*xs – Objects to normalise.
Returns:Normalised objects.
Return type:list

Normalise objects to [0, 1].

Parameters:*xs – Objects to normalise.
